newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Telecom firms six cents on Q1 result.
newsitem.headline: Telecom firms six cents on Q1 result.

text.p: Telecom New Zealand shares firmed six cents to NZ$7.58 on Tuesday after the company announced a first quarter profit of NZ$188 million, in line with forecasts.
Brokers said the result was solid. It compared with a profit of $177.1 million in the previous comparable period.

"The comment about cutting capex by $500 million is good to see. Cellular is still strong, costs are well contained and they are still achieving good growth in spite of increasing competition," Jeremy Ashcroft at brokers SBC Warburg said.

Telecom said it aimed to remove progressively NZ$500 million from its previously planned capital expenditure programme between now and the end of the 1999/2000 financial year, as part of a plan called "Performance 2000".
Tim Snedden at brokers ANZ Securities said the market would have treated the Telecom result as neutral and the rise in the share price was a function of a stronger market overall.
By 10.00 a.m. (2200 GMT) the top-40 index was 11.30 points firmer at 2,482.12, and Telecom had eased back to three cents stronger at $7.55.
